title: Two suspects charged in shooting that injured child
content:
Two men have been charged with aggravated assault after police said they fired shots at each other and a child was hit in the arm by the gunfire.
The shooting occurred Sunday morning in the Ridgecrest Apartments in Frayser.
Police responded to a fight call at the complex around 11:30 a.m. Witnesses told officers that during the fight a man they knew as "Tweet" fired a shot into the air. They told police another man then fired a shot into the crowd at Tweet.
"Tweet" then returned fire and everyone ran. A boy was hit in the left wrist. He was taken to LeBonheur Children's Hospital in noncritical condition. The child's age was not released by police.
Tweet was identified as Rommell Turner, 26. The other man who fired shots was Eric Payton, 22. Payton told police that he fired a shot at Turner, according to the arrest affidavit.
Turner refused to give investigators a statement. Both men were charged with aggravated assault and reckless endangerment.
Turner's bond was set at $75,000. Payton's bond was set at $60,000.
